desc.p: Product category end range within the APPLICATION for which asset classification and provisioning should be applied. For LD application only loan categories would be allowed. Deposit and commitment categories would be blocked. Once defined the categories cannot be removed. However new category range may be included. For all range of categories defined here, PD.PARAMETER should exist with following values set SUB.PAY.SETTING YES CHANGE.STATUS NULL NAB.PERIOD.INT NO If PD.PARAMETER does not exist for this category ID, default set-up (with COMPANY ID) would be considered for the check. All categories within CATEG.FR and CATEG.TO will have to satisfy the above criteria.
Validation Rules
Optional Input. Valid categories are LD - 21050 21074(Loan category)MG - 25000 25099PD - 20000-49999Must be a valid key in CATEGORY file.

Indicates the internal account category to which the provision amount should be parked. An internal account has to be opened in local currency for this category. System shall automatically create account for other currencies whenever needed. Defaults from LN.ASSET.CLASS and could be overridden.
Validation Rules
Valid category range 10000-19999. Invalid input if WRITE.OFF is set to "YES".
Asset classification is done at the company level and all Provisioning is based on the rules defined in this company record.
Validation Rules
Valid COMPANY ID. Mnemonic of company is also Valid.

Indicates whether WRITE.OFF is applicable for this class of asset. When the underlying contract (Like LD, MG) is fully liquidated, then the PD contract would be automatically written off (FWOF). STATUS would be updated as FWOF in PD and in the underlying contract as well. When the underlying contract is not fully liquidated, system writes an exception log in PD.PROV.EXCEPTION.LOG file and the user may manually WRITE-OFF the contract later on. Defaults from LN.ASSET.CLASS and could be overridden.
Validation Rules
Valid values are YES/NULl
Indicates the number of days, the amount type needs to be overdue, to be classified as ASSET.CLASS defined in this Multi-value set.
Validation Rules
Maximum of 5 Numeric characters. Numbers indicate Overdue in Days.
Indicates the number of days after which records in PD.PROV.EXCEPTION.LOG would be purged. Days would be validated against the RUN.DATE field of that file.
Validation Rules
Maximum of 3 numeric Characters. Mandatory Input.
Field to record the description of this record. This is a free-text field.
Validation Rules
3-35 Alphanumeric Characters Mandatory field Standard Language field.

Indicates whether income should be accrued for this class of asset. If this field is set to "NO" system would switch from accrual basis to cash basis i.e. Income would be suspended and memo accruals would be posted. STATUS would be updated as "NAB" in PD and in underlying contract and POST.END.DATE would be updated as null. Defaults from LN.ASSET.CLASS and could be overridden.
Validation Rules
Valid values are NO/YES NULL/YES would mean that Income would continue to accrue
Indicates the number of days, the amount type needs to be overdue, to be classified as ASSET.CLASS defined in this Multi-value set.
Validation Rules
Maximum of 5 Numeric characters. Valid only if DECISION is RG/NR Numbers indicate Overdue in Days.

If more than one set of conditions are to be specified for a Asset class (in the fields BRACKETS.OP to OPERAND), then Brackets could be used to prioritize the conditions. Brackets can be entered up to 4 levels of Priorities. Example: Considering a Statement: If A = 1 and B = 2 or C = 3 Without brackets Element 1 : A = 1 and B = 2 Element 2 : C = 3With bracketsIf A = 1 and (B = 2 or C = 3)Element 1 :A = 1Element 2 : B = 2 or C = 3
Validation Rules
Optional Input.Valid values are: 1 (2 ((3 (((4 (((
Indicates the frequency at which system would do provision accounting and re-classification of assets.
Validation Rules
Standard frequency field. Mandatory Input

Used as a link between one condition and the other. For example: If user want to specify asset class as 3 only when PR > 60 and IN > 20, this field could be used to link PR and IN conditions. AMT.TYPE.... PR DECISION.... GT OVERDUE.FR.. 60 OVERDUE.TO.. BRACKETS.CL. OPERAND.....AND AMT.TYPE.... IN DECISION.... GT OVERDUE.FR.. 20 OVERDUE.TO.. BRACKETS.CL. OPERAND.....
Validation Rules
Valid entries are AND/OR Optional Input. Not allowed in the last sub-value set.

Indicates the Percentage of provision applicable for this asset class. Provision would be calculated by applying this provision percentage on outstanding balance in LD/MG and overdue principal in PD. Defaults from LN.ASSET.CLASS and could be overridden.
Validation Rules
Rate field and accepts Zero value. Up to 11 characters Numeric field Invalid input if WRITE.OFF is set to "YES" Accepts decimal value.

Product category start range within the APPLICATION for which asset classification and provisioning should be applied. For LD application only loan categories would be allowed. Deposit and commitment categories would be blocked. Once defined the categories cannot be removed. However new category range may be included. For all range of categories defined here, PD.PARAMETER should exist with following values set SUB.PAY.SETTING YES CHANGE.STATUS NULL NAB.PERIOD.INT NO If PD.PARAMETER does not exist for this category ID, default set-up (COMPANY Code ID) would be considered for the check.
Validation Rules
Valid categories are LD - 21050 21074(Loan category)MG - 25000 25499PD - 20000-49999Must be a valid key in CATEGORY file.
Indicates the PL category to which provision expense should be booked. Defaults from LN.ASSET.CLASS and could be overridden.
Validation Rules
Valid category range 50000-59999. Invalid input if WRITE.OFF is set to "YES".

Specifies the type of DECISION which the user wants to perform on the field defined in the previous field. The ASSET.CLASS in the current Multi-value set is considered to be the default asset class, when this field is left NULL. When all conditions defined in the table fail, then the percentage stated in this asset class would be considered.
Validation Rules
Valid entries are EQ, GT, GE, NE, LT, LE, RG, NR Optional Input.

Conditions based on individual Amount elements could be defined using this field. For example the user could defined a condition like: If PR > 25 then asset class - 1 If (PR > 50) and (IN > 50) then asset class - 2 If (PR > 100) and (IN > 50) then asset class - 3
Validation Rules
Valid Key to PD.AMOUNT.TYPE. Special Key "ALL" is valid. It is the sum of all Individual Overdue types. If PR is 20 days due and IN is 10 days due and PE is 3 days due, ALL would mean 33 days.
Applications for which asset classifications and provisioning should be done. At present only LD, MG and PD will be supported.
Validation Rules
Optional Field Only LD, MG or PD allowed.
Indicates the asset class for which classification rules are defined in the subsequent fields.
Validation Rules
Should be valid key to LN.ASSET.CLASS table. Mandatory field.

If more than one set of conditions are to be specified for a Asset class (in the fields BRACKETS.OP to OPERAND), then Brackets could be used to prioritize the conditions. Brackets can be entered up to 4 levels of Priorities.
